qas.question: What factors have influenced Estonian food for most of their history?
What are the most common foods in Estonia?

answers.text: black bread, pork, potatoes, and dairy products.

qas.question: What fresh items do Estonians traditionally enjoy in summer and spring?
What food gathering behaviors are now seen as hobbies in modern Estonian culture?

context: Historically, the cuisine of Estonia has been heavily dependent on <a0_0>seasons and simple peasant food<a0_0/>, which today is influenced by many countries. Today, it includes many typical international foods.[citation needed] The most typical foods in Estonia are <a1_0>black bread, pork, potatoes, and dairy products.<a1_0/> Traditionally in summer and spring, Estonians like to eat everything fresh – <a2_0>berries, herbs, vegetables<a2_0/>, and everything else that comes straight from the garden. <a3_0>Hunting and fishing<a3_0/> have also been very common, although currently hunting and fishing are enjoyed mostly as hobbies. Today, it is also very popular to grill outside in summer.
